snippet: New York State is looking into the sale of the rights to the three-word name to a nonprofit, accusing a former Port Authority official of leading the deal without proper approval.
abstract: New York State is looking into sale of rights to three-word name 'World Trade Center' to nonprofit World Trade Centers Association for $10 in 1986; former Port Authority official Guy F Tozzoli, recently deceased, is accused of having made deal without approval and of receiving exorbitant annual compensation from group; Gov Andrew Cuomo has raised possibility of using state law to force Tozzoli's heirs to pay back some of money.
lead_paragraph: New York State is looking into the sale of the rights to the three-word name to a nonprofit, accusing a former Port Authority official of leading the deal without proper approval.

headline.main: $10 Deal for Rights to World Trade Center Name Draws Scrutiny
headline.print_headline: $10 Deal for Rights to ‘World Trade Center,’ Made Years Ago, Draws State Scrutiny

keywords.value: Port Authority of New York and New Jersey
keywords.name: organizations
